page.title: 08FARMING CLAPHAM CONTINUED
page.content: The sheep dog is not only used for rounding sheep up but for sniffing the sheep out of the drifts of snow. The sheep and cattle are sold round our own area,like Bentham, Gisburn, Lancaster, Hawes and Hellifield. Most of the dairy cows are milked by machinery.The milk is sent to the creamary at Settle.There it is made into cheese,butter and dried milk.Many of the beef cattle which live upon the fells are Herefords or Black Poles.In the winter the dairy cows are fed on hay,silo,sugar beet and cow cake. A few farms in the area keep pigs,and poultry. There are seven farms from which we got a different acreage.The average acreage is 92.The biggest farm was 260 acres, and the smallest was 20 acres only.
